comment.author: 22968943@N05
comment._content: Model indeed, seems unlikely the thing ever actually flew :)

comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: Alburt A. Shillcutt patented this machine in US Patent 1,043,473 on November 5, 1912. Shillcutt is given in the patent as a citizen of the United States, residing in Little Rock, Arkansas. In those times often models were made to give more truth to the patent. The drawings in the patent are remarkably similar to the model presented in the Baines picture. I think it is safe to date this picture as 1912. The machine and probably Shillcutt too are described in the early US aviation periodical Aeronautics: the American magazine of aerial locomotion year 1912, page 179. Interesting and unique picture probably, but there may be more of them in that Magazine Aeronautics. Cheers Kees
